symptoms.name: Jaw Pain & Clicking
symptoms.description: Persistent pain in jaw joints with audible clicking or popping sounds during movement

symptoms.name: Chronic Headaches
symptoms.description: Recurring headaches often mistaken for migraines, caused by jaw muscle tension
symptoms.impact: High impact on work and daily life

symptoms.name: Facial Pain
symptoms.description: Radiating pain throughout face, cheeks, and around the ears

symptoms.name: Neck & Shoulder Tension
symptoms.description: Muscle stiffness and pain extending from jaw to neck and shoulders

symptoms.name: Limited Jaw Movement
symptoms.description: Difficulty opening mouth fully or jaw locking in open/closed position

symptoms.name: Teeth Grinding (Bruxism)
symptoms.description: Unconscious grinding or clenching of teeth, especially during sleep
symptoms.impact: Causes tooth damage and sleep disruption

symptoms.name: Ear Problems
symptoms.description: Ear pain, ringing (tinnitus), or feeling of fullness in ears

symptoms.name: Sleep Disturbances
symptoms.description: Poor sleep quality due to pain and unconscious jaw clenching
symptoms.impact: Severely impacts overall health and energy

faq.question: What makes Dr. Pedro's TMJ treatment different?
faq.answer: Dr. Pedro is the only provider on Staten Island offering the complete range of advanced TMJ technologies including BOTOX, electrophoresis, and acoustic shockwave therapy. He takes a comprehensive, individualized approach rather than the one-size-fits-all bruxism appliance approach used by most providers.

faq.question: How quickly will I see results?
faq.answer: Most patients experience immediate relief from BOTOX treatments within 24-48 hours. Comprehensive treatment plans typically show significant improvement within 2-6 weeks, with many patients achieving complete pain relief.

faq.question: Is BOTOX safe for TMJ treatment?
faq.answer: Yes, BOTOX is FDA-approved for TMJ treatment and has an excellent safety profile when administered by trained specialists like Dr. Pedro. He is certified in TMJ BOTOX therapy and uses pain-free injection techniques.

faq.question: Will insurance cover TMJ treatment?
faq.answer: Many insurance plans cover TMJ treatment, especially when medically necessary. We work with patients to maximize insurance benefits and offer financing options for any remaining costs.

faq.question: What if other treatments haven't worked?
faq.answer: Many of our patients come to us after failed treatments elsewhere. Dr. Pedro's advanced diagnostic approach and comprehensive treatment options often succeed where others have failed. We specialize in complex TMJ cases.

faq.question: How long do TMJ treatments last?
faq.answer: BOTOX treatments typically last 3-6 months. Other treatments like acoustic shockwave therapy provide longer-lasting benefits. With proper management, many patients achieve long-term relief with periodic maintenance.
